00017 package WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::LoginProctor;
00018 use base qw(WeBWorK::ContentGenerator);
00019 
00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::LoginProctor - display a login form for 
00023 GatewayQuiz proctored tests.
00024 
00025 =cut
00026 
00027 use strict;
00028 use warnings;
00029 use CGI qw(-nosticky );
00030 use WeBWorK::Utils qw(readFile dequote);
00031 use WeBWorK::DB::Utils qw(grok_vsetID);
00032 use WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::GatewayQuiz qw(can_recordAnswers);
00033 
00034 use mod_perl;
00035 use constant MP2 => ( exists $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} and $ENV{MOD_PERL_API_VERSION} >= 2 );
00036 
00037 # This content generator is NOT logged in.
00038 # FIXME  I'm not sure this is really what we want for the proctor login,
00039 # FIXME  but I also don't know what this actually does, so I'm ignoring it
00040 # FIXME  for now.
00041 sub if_loggedin {
00042     my ($self, $arg) = @_;
00043     
00044     return !$arg;
00045 }
00046 
00047 sub info {
00048     my ($self) = @_;
00049     my $r = $self->r;
00050     my $ce = $r->ce;
00051     
00052     my $result;
00053     
00054     # This section should be kept in sync with the Home.pm version
00055     my $site_info = $ce->{webworkFiles}->{site_info};
00056     if (defined $site_info and $site_info) {
00057         # deal with previewing a temporary file
00058         # FIXME: DANGER: this code allows viewing of any file
00059         # FIXME: this code is disabled because PGProblemEditor no longer uses editFileSuffix
00060         #if (defined $r->param("editMode") and $r->param("editMode") eq "temporaryFile"
00061         #       and defined $r->param("editFileSuffix")) {
00062         #   $site_info .= $r->param("editFileSuffix");
00063         #}
00064         
00065         if (-f $site_info) {
00066             my $text = eval { readFile($site_info) };
00067             if ($@) {
00068                 $result .= CGI::h2("Site Information");
00069                 $result .= CGI::div({class=>"ResultsWithError"}, $@);
00070             } elsif ($text =~ /\S/) {
00071                 $result .= CGI::h2("Site Information");
00072                 $result .= $text;
00073             }
00074         }
00075     }
00076     
00077     # FIXME this is basically the same code as above... TIME TO REFACTOR!
00078     my $login_info = $ce->{courseFiles}->{login_info};
00079     if (defined $login_info and $login_info) {
00080         # login info is relative to the templates directory, apparently
00081         $login_info = $ce->{courseDirs}->{templates} . "/$login_info";
00082         
00083         # deal with previewing a temporary file
00084         # FIXME: DANGER: this code allows viewing of any file
00085         # FIXME: this code is disabled because PGProblemEditor no longer uses editFileSuffix
00086         #if (defined $r->param("editMode") and $r->param("editMode") eq "temporaryFile"
00087         #       and defined $r->param("editFileSuffix")) {
00088         #   $login_info .= $r->param("editFileSuffix");
00089         #}
00090         
00091         if (-f $login_info) {
00092             my $text = eval { readFile($login_info) };
00093             if ($@) {
00094                 $result .= CGI::h2("Login Info");
00095                 $result .= CGI::div({class=>"ResultsWithError"}, $@);
00096             } elsif ($text =~ /\S/) {
00097                 $result .= CGI::h2("Login Info");
00098                 $result .= $text;
00099             }
00100         }
00101     }
00102     
00103     if (defined $result and $result ne "") {
00104         return CGI::div({class=>"info-box", id=>"InfoPanel"}, $result);
00105     } else {
00106         return "";
00107     }
00108 }
00109 
00110 sub body {
00111     my ($self) = @_;
00112     my $r = $self->r;
00113     my $ce = $r->ce;
00114     my $db = $r->db;
00115     my $urlpath = $r->urlpath;
00116     
00117   # convenient data variables
00118     my $effectiveUser = $r->param("effectiveUser") || "";
00119     my $user = $r->param("user");
00120     my $proctorUser = $r->param("proctor_user") || "";
00121     my $key = $r->param("proctor_key");
00122     my $passwd = $r->param("proctor_passwd") || "";
00123     my $course = $urlpath->arg("courseID");
00124     my $setID = $urlpath->arg("setID");
00125     my $timeNow = time();
00126 
00127   # these are to manage the transition to, and possibly back from,
00128   #    the grading proctor
00129     my $pastProctorUser = $r->param("past_proctor_user") || $proctorUser;
00130     my $pastProctorKey = $r->param("past_proctor_key") || $key;
00131 
00132   # data collection
00133     my $submitAnswers = $r->param("submitAnswers");
00134     my $EffectiveUser = $db->getUser($effectiveUser);
00135     my $User = $db->getUser($user);
00136 
00137     my $effectiveUserFullName = $EffectiveUser->first_name() . " " . 
00138         $EffectiveUser->last_name();
00139 
00140     # we need the UserSet to check for a set-restricted login proctor,
00141     #    and to show and possibly save the submission time.
00142     #    and to get the UserSet, we need to know what set and version
00143     #    we're working with.  if the setName and versionName come in 
00144     #    with the setID, we're ok; otherwise, get the highest version
00145     #    number available and go with that
00146     my ($setName, $versionNum) = grok_vsetID($setID);
00147     my $noSetVersions = 0;
00148     if ( ! $versionNum ) {
00149         # get a list of all available versions
00150         my @setVersions = $db->listSetVersions($effectiveUser,
00151                                $setName);
00152         if ( @setVersions ) {
00153             $versionNum = $setVersions[-1];
00154         } else {
00155             # if there are no versions yet, we must be starting
00156             #    the first one
00157             $versionNum = 1;
00158             $noSetVersions = 1;
00159         }
00160     }
00161     # get the merged set; if we're not grading a test, 
00162     #    get the merged template set instead
00163     my $UserSet;
00164     if ( $noSetVersions || ! $submitAnswers ) {
00165         $UserSet = $db->getMergedSet($effectiveUser, $setName);
00166     } else {
00167         $UserSet = $db->getMergedSetVersion($effectiveUser, $setName,
00168                             $versionNum);
00169     }
00170 
00171     # let's just make sure that worked
00172     die("Proctor authorization requested for a nonexistent " .
00173         "set?\n") if ( ! defined( $UserSet ) );
00174   
00175     # now, if we're submitting the set we need to save the 
00176     #    submission time.
00177     if ( $submitAnswers ) {
00178         # this shouldn't ever happen
00179         if ( $noSetVersions ) {
00180             die("Request to grade a set version before " .
00181                 "any tests have been taken.");
00182         }
00183         # we save the submission time if the attempt will be recorded,
00184         #   so we have to do some research to determine if that's 
00185         #   the case
00186         my $PermissionLevel = $db->getPermissionLevel($user);
00187         my $Problem = 
00188             $db->getMergedProblemVersion($effectiveUser, $setName,
00189                          $versionNum, 1);
00190         # set last_attempt_time if appropriate
00191         if ( WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::GatewayQuiz::can_recordAnswers($self, $User, $PermissionLevel, 
00192             $EffectiveUser, $UserSet, $Problem) ) {
00193             $UserSet->version_last_attempt_time( $timeNow );
00194             # FIXME: this saves all of the merged set data into 
00195             #    the set_user table.  we live with this in other
00196             #    places for versioned sets, but it's not ideal
00197             $db->putSetVersion( $UserSet );
00198         }
00199     }
00200 
00201     
00202     print CGI::p(CGI::strong("Proctor authorization required."), "\n\n");
00203     # WeBWorK::Authen::verifyProctor will set the note "authen_error" 
00204     # if invalid authentication is found.  If this is done, it's a signal to
00205     # us to yell at the user for doing that, since Authen isn't a content-
00206     # generating module.
00207     my $authen_error = MP2 ? $r->notes->get("authen_error") : $r->notes("authen_error");
00208     if ($authen_error) {
00209         print CGI::div({class=>"ResultsWithError"},
00210             CGI::p($authen_error)
00211         );
00212     }
00213     
00214     # also print a message about submission times if we're submitting 
00215     # an answer
00216     if ( $submitAnswers ) {
00217         my $dueTime = $UserSet->due_date();
00218         my $timeLimit = $UserSet->version_time_limit();
00219         my ($color, $msg) = ("#ddddff", "");
00220 
00221         if ( $dueTime + $ce->{gatewayGracePeriod} < $timeNow ) {
00222         $color = "#ffffaa";
00223         $msg = CGI::br() . "\nThe time limit on this assignment " .
00224             "was exceeded.\nThe assignment may be checked, but " .
00225             "the result will not be counted.\n";
00226         }
00227         my $style = "background-color: $color; color: black; " .
00228         "border: solid black 1px; padding: 2px;";
00229         print CGI::div({-style=>$style}, 
00230                CGI::strong("Grading assignment: ", CGI::br(), 
00231                        "Submission time: ", 
00232                        scalar(localtime($timeNow)), CGI::br(),
00233                        "Due: ",
00234                        scalar(localtime($dueTime)), $msg));
00235     }
00236 
00237     # start printing the form
00238     print CGI::startform({-method=>"POST", -action=>$r->uri});
00239     # write out the form data posted to the requested URI
00240     my @fields_to_print = 
00241         grep { ! /^(user)|(effectiveUser)|(passwd)|(key)|(force_password_authen)|(proctor_user)|(proctor_key)|(proctor_password)$/ } $r->param();
00242 
00243     print $self->hidden_fields(@fields_to_print) if ( @fields_to_print );
00244     print $self->hidden_authen_fields,"\n";
00245 
00246     print CGI::hidden(-name=>"past_proctor_user",
00247               -value=>$pastProctorUser);
00248     print CGI::hidden(-name=>"past_proctor_key",
00249               -value=>$pastProctorKey);
00250 
00251     # skip printing the user's name and all if we're doing a restricted
00252     #    set login
00253     my $userNameFields = '';
00254     if ( $submitAnswers || 
00255          ( $UserSet->restricted_login_proctor eq '' ||
00256            $UserSet->restricted_login_proctor eq 'No' ) ) {
00257         print CGI::div({style=>"background-color:#ddddff;"},
00258                    CGI::p("User's username is: ", 
00259                       CGI::strong("$effectiveUser"),"\n",
00260                       CGI::br(),"User's name is: ", 
00261                       CGI::strong("$effectiveUserFullName"),
00262                       "\n")),"\n";
00263         $userNameFields = CGI::td([
00264                     "Proctor username:",
00265                     CGI::input({-type=>"text", 
00266                             -name=>"proctor_user", 
00267                             -value=>""}),
00268                     ]);
00269     } else {
00270         print CGI::start_div({style=>"background-color:#ddddff;"});
00271         print CGI::em("This set has a set-level proctor ",
00272                   "password to authorize logins. ",
00273                   "Enter the password below.");
00274         print CGI::end_div();
00275         print CGI::hidden(-name=>'proctor_user',
00276                   -value=>"set_id:$setName");
00277     }
00278 
00279     # then print out the table for the username, if needed, and 
00280     #    password for the proctor
00281     print CGI::start_table({class=>"FormLayout"});
00282     print CGI::Tr( $userNameFields ) if ( $userNameFields );
00283     print CGI::Tr( CGI::td([
00284                 "Proctor password:",
00285                 CGI::input({-type=>"password", 
00286                         -name=>"proctor_passwd", 
00287                         -value=>""}),
00288                 ])
00289                );
00290     print CGI::end_table();
00291     
00292     print CGI::input({-type=>"submit", -value=>"Continue"});
00293     print CGI::endform();
00294     
00295     return "";
00296 }
